programme.desc: Yasujiro Ozu's Japanese drama explores the power of speech. Two boys refuse to speak until their family get a TV, but the parents resist, afraid it will kill the art of conversation.
programme.title: Good Morning

programme.desc: Drama starring Dirk Bogarde as a married, but secretly gay, barrister who risks his reputation to track down blackmailers who are targeting gay friends and colleagues. [AD,S]
programme.title: Victim

programme.desc: Howard Hawks' Second World War propaganda morale-booster and tribute to the air force focuses on the crew of a single B-17 Flying Fortress, the 'Mary Ann'.
programme.title: Air Force

programme.desc: From the team behind Ice Age, this animated coming-of-age-tale features Rodney Copperbottom, an inventor who travels to Robot City to sell his ideas to the tycoon Big Weld.
programme.title: Robots

programme.desc: Comedy in which Jennifer Lopez meets the man of her dreams (Michael Vartan), but his mother (Jane Fonda) is hell-bent against the match and sets out to destroy it. [AD,S]
programme.title: Monster-in-Law

programme.desc: Thriller starring Mark Wahlberg as an ex-marksman called out of retirement by Danny Glover to foil an assassination attempt on the President. Bloody violence/strong language.
programme.title: Shooter

programme.desc: Michael Keaton is in deep mourning for his dead wife Anna (Chandra West) when medium Ian McNeice shockingly tells him that she is attempting to contact him. Supernatural horror. [AD,S]
programme.title: White Noise

programme.desc: Nathan Fillion tries to kill himself after witnessing his wife and child's murder but, brought back to life, he finds he can see the auras of those about to die. Supernatural horror. [AD,S]
programme.title: White Noise 2: The Light
